results.title: Africans all
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Greg Knowles
results.brief_description: A vast land of contradictions seen by plane from Algiers to Capetown, its varied history, primitive in the south and highly civilized in the north. The wide range of climatic and geographical conditions and their effect on the way of life. Thriving cosmopolitan cities and tiny villages; jungle growth; desert; mineral wealth and arid lands, people black and white; all are part of the African continent.
results.creator_credit_for_label: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Greg Knowles

results.title: African Wildlife
results.brief_description: Witness the realities of birth, death and survival in a vivid encounter with the animal world. Filmed in Namibia’s Etosha National Park over the course of two years, the film captures extraordinary close-ups of animal behaviour, a wildebeest giving birth, a zebra mother successfully defending her foal from the swift attack of a cheetah, and a young springbok alerting his herd to the presence of a predator with stiff-legged leaps.

results.title: African violets
results.brief_description: This program looks at the large range of African violets and Streptocarpus (Cape Primrose) available, and their care. British gardening experts Rev. Tony Clements and Anne Swithinbank demonstrate propagation by leaf cuttings and division. Correct potting techniques as well as hybridisations by cross-pollination are shown. The common pests and diseases affecting African violets are discussed, as well as the watering techniques and best growing conditions to encourage abundant flowers on these popular plants from Tanzania.

results.title: African village life: fishing on the Niger River
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: Shows how Bozo tribesmen in Mali, West Africa, obtain one of their most important food staples from the Niger River, using the most primitive kind of equipment. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: Shows how Bozo tribesmen in Mali, West Africa, build their houses using materials yielded by the river and centuries-old techniques.

results.title: African village life: building a boat on the Niger
results.brief_description: Shows how members of the Bozo tribe build a boat with limited tools and materials: glue, nails, strips of cloth and mud are used to make the boat watertight.
results.title_for_label: African village life: building a boat on the Niger

results.title: African odyssey: the two worlds of Musembe
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Albert Waller
results.brief_description: The two worlds of 11 year-old Musembe are the two worlds of 20th century Africa: the modern city where Musembe and his parents live in a large apartment building, and the primitive village where his civil servant father was born. A journey “home” - back to the family’s village - shows us the natural beauty of Kenya and gives a very human insight into the decisions which confront many Africans today. Musembe feels drawn to the village, and the tribal customs but his father reminds him, “We are city people now”, and we realize the emotional conflicts which come with rapid social change.
results.title_for_label: African odyssey: the two worlds of Musembe
results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America and Albert Waller

results.title: African odyssey: the red bicycle
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Albert Waller
results.brief_description: The travels of a red bicycle, assembled in Nairobi, enable us to learn about economic life in Africa, as it passes to a succession of owners. A tribal chief visiting the city buys it for his son and takes it back to his village in the bush. Subsequently, it is acquired by a young farmer, a government coffee tester, some tourists on safari, and eventually returned to the original village, where its parts are broken up and shared by everyone.

results.title: African music: old and new
results.brief_description: An introduction to traditional African musical instruments such as flutes, rattles, drums and the Mbira. A modern concert is seen, which shows two African musicians using the traditional instruments with modern ones. These include amplified African drums, electric guitar, a wired Mbira and flutes.
